description: A popular dice game played with friends and family, also known as Zonk, Zilch, and 10,000.

rules.objective: The goal is to be the first player to reach a certain number of points, typically 10,000.
equipment: A score sheet or an electronic scoring device

starting_the_game: Decide who goes first by rolling a single die; the player with the highest number goes first.
Players take turns rolling all six dice.

additional_scoring: If a player rolls a straight (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6) in a single roll, they get 1500 points.
If a player rolls three pairs in a single roll, they get 1500 points.

farkling: If a player rolls dice and doesn't score any points, it's called a 'Farkle.'
If a player Farkles, they lose all the points they accumulated in that turn, and it becomes the next player's turn.
ending_a_turn: After each roll, the player must decide whether to stop and keep the points scored or continue rolling the remaining dice.
If all six dice are scoring, the player can choose to roll all six dice again.
busting: If a player rolls and none of the dice score points, they lose all the points accumulated in the entire game, and their turn ends.
gameplay.winning: The first player to reach a certain point threshold (usually 10,000) wins the game.

house_rules: Some groups may have additional rules or variations, such as allowing certain scoring combinations to be carried over between turns.

reminder: These rules are a general guide, and house rules may apply. It's always a good idea to clarify the rules with all players before starting a game.
